# Checklist: Limitation and Deadlines

<!-- 
  Purpose: Identify, calculate, and manage all limitation periods and critical deadlines.
  Usage: Complete immediately upon instruction and review regularly.
  Criticality: Missing limitation periods can be negligent - use this checklist without fail.
-->

---

## Instructions

- Complete this checklist IMMEDIATELY upon taking instructions
- Review and update whenever new information emerges
- Diary ALL deadlines with advance warnings (minimum 3 levels: 3 months, 1 month, 1 week before)
- Review weekly during limitation-critical periods
- Escalate any limitation concerns to supervisor IMMEDIATELY
- File completed checklist and keep updated version current

---

### If Out of Time

  - [ ] Other reason: ........................

- [ ] Prospects of permission: [ ] Good [ ] Uncertain [ ] Poor

- [ ] Client advised that permission required and prospects
- [ ] Application for permission to be made with claim

### Actions

- [ ] Responsible: ........................
- [ ] Counsel instructed if necessary
- [ ] Court fee arranged
- [ ] Status: [ ] On track [ ] At risk [ ] URGENT ACTION NEEDED

---

## 3. VALIDITY CHALLENGES

### Applicability

- [ ] Challenging validity of will (capacity, undue influence, fraud, etc.)
- [ ] Not applicable

### Limitation Position

**General Rule:** No strict limitation period for probate actions, BUT:
- Laches (delay) may bar relief
- Presumption of regularity strengthens over time
- Must act promptly

### Time Since Death

**Date of Death:** ........................  
**Time Elapsed:** ........................ years/months

**Assessment:**
- [ ] Recent death (< 1 year) - strong position
- [ ] Moderate delay (1-3 years) - explain delay
- [ ] Significant delay (3-5 years) - risk of laches
- [ ] Substantial delay (> 5 years) - serious laches risk

### Time Since Grant

**Date of Grant:** ........................  
**Time Elapsed:** ........................ years/months

### Reasons for Any Delay

- [ ] Recently discovered evidence: ........................
- [ ] Lack of knowledge of facts: ........................
- [ ] Attempts at settlement: ........................
- [ ] Other: ........................

### Risk Assessment

- [ ] Laches risk: [ ] Low [ ] Medium [ ] High
- [ ] Explanation for delay documented
- [ ] Client advised of delay risks
- [ ] Urgency level: [ ] Routine [ ] Important [ ] URGENT

### Actions

- [ ] Proceedings to be issued by: ........................
- [ ] Interim steps to preserve position:
  - [ ] Caveat entered: Date ........................
  - [ ] Warning to caveat: Date ........................
  - [ ] Other: ........................

---

## 4. PROPRIETARY ESTOPPEL / CONSTRUCTIVE TRUST CLAIMS

### Applicability

- [ ] Proprietary estoppel claim
- [ ] Constructive trust claim
- [ ] Not applicable

### Limitation Period

**Depends on nature of claim:**

- [ ] Claim for land: 12 years from accrual (Limitation Act 1980, s.15)
  - Accrual date: ........................
  - Limitation expiry: ........................

- [ ] Claim for personal property: 6 years from accrual (Limitation Act 1980, s.2)
  - Accrual date: ........................
  - Limitation expiry: ........................

- [ ] Fraudulent concealment: 6 years from discovery (Limitation Act 1980, s.32)
  - Date of discovery: ........................
  - Limitation expiry: ........................

### Calculation

**Cause of action accrued when:** ........................

**Limitation period:** ........................ years

**Limitation expiry date:** ........................

**Days/months remaining:** ........................

### Status

- [ ] Within limitation - adequate time
- [ ] Within limitation - approaching expiry - MONITOR CLOSELY
- [ ] Outside limitation - discretion required / explain basis for extension
- [ ] Unclear - further advice needed

### Actions

- [ ] Deadline diarized with warnings
- [ ] Issue by: ........................
- [ ] Status: [ ] On track [ ] At risk [ ] URGENT

---

## 5. EXECUTOR/ADMINISTRATOR CLAIMS

### Applicability

- [ ] Claim against executor/administrator for breach of duty
- [ ] Passing of accounts
- [ ] Not applicable

### Limitation Periods

**Type of claim determines limitation:**

- [ ] Breach of trust: No limitation (but laches applies)
- [ ] Breach of fiduciary duty: No limitation (but laches applies)
- [ ] Contractual claim against executor: 6 years from breach
- [ ] Specialty: 12 years

### For Breach of Trust/Fiduciary Duty

**Date of breach/loss:** ........................

**Time since breach:** ........................

**Laches assessment:**
- [ ] Low risk (recent)
- [ ] Medium risk (explain delay)
- [ ] High risk (significant delay)

### For Contractual/Other Claims

**Cause of action date:** ........................  
**Limitation period:** ........................ years  
**Expiry date:** ........................  
**Time remaining:** ........................

### Actions

- [ ] Limitation position confirmed
- [ ] Deadline diarized
- [ ] Proceedings to issue by: ........................

---

## 6. PROFESSIONAL NEGLIGENCE CLAIMS

### Applicability

- [ ] Potential claim against solicitor who prepared will
- [ ] Potential claim against other professional
- [ ] Not applicable

### Limitation Period

**6 years from accrual OR 3 years from knowledge (s.14A Limitation Act 1980)**

### Accrual of Cause of Action

**When negligence occurred:** ........................  
**When loss suffered:** ........................  
**6-year expiry:** ........................

### Knowledge Date (s.14A)

**When client knew or should have known:**
- Material facts: ........................
- That they constituted actionable negligence: ........................

**3-year expiry from knowledge:** ........................

### Longstop

**15 years from negligent act (s.14B):** ........................

### Latest Expiry Date

**Limitation expires:** ........................

**Days/months remaining:** ........................

### Status

- [ ] Within limitation - adequate time
- [ ] Within limitation - approaching - URGENT
- [ ] Outside primary period - rely on s.14A knowledge
- [ ] Outside all periods - cannot proceed

### Actions if Relevant

- [ ] Consider separate claim against professional
- [ ] Letter of claim to professional
- [ ] Notify professional indemnity insurers
- [ ] Issue by: ........................

## 8. CAVEAT AND CITATIONS

### Caveat

**Purpose:** Prevent grant of probate/administration being issued

**Status:**
- [ ] Caveat entered
  - Date: ........................
  - Index: ........................
  - By: ........................
  - Expires: [Caveats last indefinitely unless warned]

- [ ] Caveat warned
  - Date of warning: ........................
  - Appearance entered by: ........................
  - Cease procedure issued: [ ] Yes [ ] No

- [ ] No caveat - consider if appropriate

**Next Actions:**
- [ ] Enter caveat by: ........................
- [ ] Enter appearance by: ........................ (8 days from warning)
- [ ] Issue cease or issue proceedings: ........................

## 12. DIARY SYSTEM

### Diarizing Protocol

For EVERY critical deadline, diary:

- [ ] 3 months before (if applicable)
- [ ] 1 month before
- [ ] 2 weeks before
- [ ] 1 week before
- [ ] 3 days before
- [ ] 1 day before
- [ ] Deadline date

### Systems Used

- [ ] Case management system diaries set
- [ ] Personal diary entries made
- [ ] Team calendar updated
- [ ] Supervisor notified of critical deadlines
- [ ] Client notified of approaching deadlines

### Backup

- [ ] Secondary diary system in place
- [ ] Cover arrangements for holidays/absence noted
- [ ] Escalation procedure if deadline at risk

---

**REMEMBER:**
- Missing a limitation period can be negligent and cause significant loss
- When in doubt, issue protective proceedings
- Always seek supervisor approval for limitation-sensitive matters
- Document everything
- Communicate regularly with client about deadlines
